articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: WINDER, Ga. (AP) — More than a year ago, tips about online posts threatening a school shooting led Georgia police to interview a 13-year-old boy, but investigators didn’t have enough evidence for an arrest.
articles.title: Teen charged with killing 4 at Georgia high school had been focus of earlier tips about threats

articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: WINDER, Ga. (AP) — More than a year ago, tips about online posts threatening a school shooting led Georgia police to interview a 13-year-old boy, but investigators didn’t have enough evidence for an arrest.
articles.title: Teen charged with killing 4 at Georgia high school had been focus of earlier tips about threats

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Palestinian health officials say Israeli strikes in the occupied West Bank killed six people, including the son of a prominent jailed militant.Israel said all of those killed were militants who had been involved in attacks.
articles.title: Israel-Hamas war latest: Israeli strikes kill 6 in occupied West Bank, Palestinian officials say

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will debate for the first — and perhaps, last — time on Tuesday night as the presidential candidates fight to sway voters on the biggest stage in U.S.
articles.title: Can Harris prosecute the political case against Trump? Key questions ahead of their debate

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A judge will hear arguments Thursday about the potential next steps in the federal election subversion prosecution of Donald Trump in the first hearing since the Supreme Court narrowed the case by ruling that former presidents are entitled to broad immunity from criminal charges.
articles.title: Trump election subversion case back in court as judge holds hearing that could set its path forward

articles.author: MATTHIAS SCHRADER and GEIR MOULSON
articles.description: MUNICH (AP) — Police in Munich exchanged fire with a man on Thursday, fatally wounding the suspect in an area near a museum on the city's Nazi-era history and the Israeli Consulate.According to a police spokesperson, officers were alerted to a person carrying a “long gun” in the Karolinenplatz area, near downtown Munich, at around 9 a.m.
articles.title: Munich police kill an armed man during an exchange of fire near a museum and the Israeli Consulate

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and EDNA TARIGAN
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Pope Francis and the grand imam of Southeast Asia’s largest mosque vowed Thursday to fight religiously inspired violence and protect the environment, issuing a joint call for interfaith friendship and common cause at the heart of Francis’ visit to Indonesia.
articles.title: Pope and imam of Southeast Asia's largest mosque make joint call to fight violence, protect planet

articles.author: PAUL WISEMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Laid off by the music streaming service Spotify last year, Joovay Arias figured he’d land another job as a software engineer fairly soon. His previous job search, in 2019, had been a breeze.
articles.title: Americans who have a job are feeling secure. Not so for many who are looking for one

articles.description: PARIS (AP) — President Emmanuel Macron named EU former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as France’s new prime minister on Thursday after more than 50 days of caretaker government.
articles.title: Macron names EU former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as France’s new prime minister

articles.author: EVELYNE MUSAMBI
articles.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — Ugandan Olympic athlete Rebecca Cheptegei has died at a Kenyan hospital where she was being treated after 80% of her body was burned in an attack by her partner.
articles.title: Ugandan Olympic athlete dies after being severely burned by her partner over a land dispute
